title: The Washington Manual
description:
Expert diagnosis and treatment recommendations fully integrated with Prime PubMed

ABOUT WASHINGTON MANUAL OF MEDICAL THERAPEUTICS
The Washington Manual streamlines diagnosis and treatment recommendations for hundreds of medical conditions on your mobile device without the need for an internet connection. Interns, residents, and medical students save valuable time by searching for practical answers to medical questions encountered on a regular basis. Evidence-based entries present current therapeutic options and Prime PubMed integration delivers supporting abstracts and journal articles directly to your mobile device in the hospital and at the bedside.

ABOUT DAVIS'S DRUG GUIDE
Davis’s Drug Guide is the perfect compliment to your Washington Manual app. Davis's Drug Guide is the best-selling drug database trusted by thousands of healthcare professionals. It delivers frequently updated information on over 5,000 trade name and generic drugs. Each monograph, with its focus on safety, includes details on pharmacokinetics, dosing, side effects, interactions, assessment, and more. 

BUNDLE FEATURES
• Comprehensive coverage of many areas of medicine and the core subspecialties 
• 600+ new and updated quick-reference topics
• 5000+ updating drug entries
• Decision support algorithms for diagnosis and treatment
• Evidence-based description of proven therapies
• Reference links to the medical literature through Prime PubMed
• General principles, diagnosis, and treatment information for each disease entry
• Pill Images and audio pronunciations
• Cross Links between resources
• Create custom notes and highlights within entries
• “Favorites” for bookmarking important entries

Prime PubMed 
Quickly search the complete PubMed database on your smartphone and tablet. Results contain abstracts, citations, and links to available full text articles that can be read on device and shared with classmates and colleagues. Additionally, Prime PubMed Search contains Grapherence™, an exclusive way to visually explore interrelationships and relevance in the medical literature.

Washington Manual Editors: Siri Ancha, MD; Christine Auberle, MD; Devin Cash, MD, PhD; Mohit Harsh, MD; John Hickman, MD, Carole Kounga, MD, PharmD [Internal Medicine Chief Residents from the Washington University School of Medicine and Barnes-Jewish Hospital in St. Louis.]
Publisher: Wolters Kluwer
Powered by: Unbound Medicine

Davis's Drug Guide Authors: April Hazard Vallerand, PhD, RN, FAAN; Cynthia A. Sanoski, BS, PharmD, FCCP, BCPS 
Publisher: F.A. Davis 
Powered by: Unbound Medicine

Your Davis’s Drug Guide subscription automatically renews annually unless auto-renew is turned off 24 hours prior to the conclusion of your current period. If you choose not to renew, you will continue to have access to the content, but will no longer receive updates. Your Google Play account will automatically be charged the current renewal rate ($99.99) within 24 hours prior to the end of the subscription period. This will ensure you receive all updates for the following year. Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings after purchase. 

Unbound Privacy Policy: www.unboundmedicine.com/privacy
Unbound Terms of Use: https://www.unboundmedicine.com/end_user_license_agreement
